result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha E. Grulkowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:17 pm 
INCLUDES 14CM1621, 14CM1726, 14CM2170, 14CM2171, 15CM155, 15CM156, AND 15CM303. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Michael Hughes.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 14CM1726: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM2170: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM155: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM156: Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM303: Ct. 1 (Theft)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CM1621: Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM1726: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM2171: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1 in 14CM1621>>30 days MCJ with huber for school/work/treatment/child care if def qualifies under jail criteria to run concurrent to sentences in 14CM1726 and 14CM2171. 
                           : On Ct. 2 in 14CM1726 and Cts. 1, 2, and 3 in 14CM2171>>9 months MCJ with huber for school/work/treatment/child care if def qualifies under jail criteria on each to run concurrent with each other and concurrent to sentence in 14CM1621. 
COURT ORDERS payment of court costs in each of the 3 files with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 82 days jail credit in 14CM1621, and 81 days jail credit in 14CM1726 and 14CM2171. 

Adj: 1:38 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
